name: Kepler-34
scenarioDescription:
The Kepler-34 Exoplanetary System


Overview

Kepler-34 is a star with 1.05 times the mass of the Sun, and 1.16 times its radius. It is located 4889.078439999999 light years away from the solar system.

Kepler-34 is known to have 1 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the Kepler-34 system

Kepler-34 b

Kepler-34 b was discovered by the Kepler observatory using the Transit method. The mass of Kepler-34 b is 69.92 times the mass of Earth. The radius of Kepler-34 b is 8.564 that of Earth. At more than 10 Earth masses, Kepler-34 b is an ice giant, a planet that is made up mostly of volatiles like water, amonia and methane, and enveloped by a dense hydrogen and helium atmosphere, much like Uranus and Neptune in our solar system. At more than 50 Earth masses, Kepler-34 b is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system Kepler-34, which contains 1 planets and was discovered by Kepler.
